title: Triangle of Power
description: In math, exponents, logarithms, and roots all circle around the same idea, but the notation for each varies radically.  The triangle of power is an alternate notation, which I find to be absolutely beautiful.

title: Snell's law proof using springs
description: This is a supplement to the Brachistochrone video, proving Snell's law with a clever little argument by Mark Levi.

title: The Brachistochrone, with Steven Strogatz
description: Steven Strogatz and I talk about a famous historical math problem, a clever solution, and a modern twist.

title: Fractal charm: Space filling curves
description: A montage of space-filling curves meant as a supplement to the Hilbert curve video.

title: Music And Measure Theory
description: A connection between a classical puzzle about rational numbers and what makes music harmonious.

title: How to count to 1000 on two hands
description: Typically when we think of counting on two hands, we count up to 10, but fingers can contain much more information than that!  This video shows how to think about counting in binary.

title: What does it feel like to invent math?
description: An exploration of infinite sums, from convergent to divergent, including a brief introduction to the 2-adic metric, all themed on that cycle between discovery and invention in math.

title: Euler's Formula and Graph Duality
description: A description of planar graph duality, and how it can be applied in a particularly elegant proof of Euler's Characteristic Formula.

title: Circle Division Solution
description: An explanation of a neat circle puzzle involving combinatorics, graphs, Euler's characteristic formula and pascal's triangle.

title: A Curious Pattern Indeed
description: A teaser for some future videos regarding a pattern which lures an unsuspecting doodler into thinking it will be powers of two.
